w:r.w:t: The teacher will teach places/classes at school by using TPR, sentence frames, and vocabulary. Students will study these words and phrases: math, English, science, Social Studies, P.E., Music, Art, What class is this?, This is ___, I add in Math class, I write in English class, I do experiments in Science class, I use a globe in Social Studies class
At completion of this lesson, students will be able to:
Recognize, spell, and pronounce the words for classes/places at school
Spell and pronounce common associated words
Use sets of words in complete sentences
Word List: math, English, science, S.S. P.E., Music, Art
This slide will always be the Naativ-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.
Greet your student and introduce the lesson concept: “Today, we are going to be learning about the subjects at school!
Circle all of the different subjects (the soccer ball, the paint set, the globe, the protractor, etc.) to show the different subjects we have at school.
Circle to the equations on the board and say,

Use a puppet to model the question and answer. Ask the puppet, “What class is this?” Have the puppet say, “This is Math class.” Then ask the student, “What class is this?” Encourage the student to say, “This is Math class.”
Answer, “What do you do in Math class?” with, “I add in Math class.”
Circle the first picture and say,
while holding up fingers to act out the word,
. Circle the second picture and say,
Clear the screen and have the child repeat two times.

Use a puppet: Ask the puppet, “What do you do in Math class?” The puppet should answer, “I add in Math class.” Then ask the child, “What do you do in Math class?” Encourage the child to answer appropriately.
Circle to the word on the board and say,

Use a puppet to model the question and answer. Ask the puppet, “What class is this?” Have the puppet say, “This is English class.” Then ask the student, “What class is this?” Encourage the student to say, “This is English class.”
Answer, “What do you do in English class?” with, “I add in English class.”
Circle the first picture and say,
(pretend to write to show the action for
. Circle the second picture and say,
Clear the screen and have the child repeat two times.

Use a puppet: Ask the puppet, “What do you do in English class?” The puppet should answer, “I write in English class.” Then ask the child, “What do you do in English class?” Encourage the child to answer appropriately.
Draw a line to the correct action word. Do the action for each word.
Tell the child to draw a line from the picture to the word. Read the words to the child if needed.
Have the child read the words one at a time and do the action.
Circle the microscope and beakers and say,

Use a puppet to model the question and answer. Ask the puppet, “What class is this?” Have the puppet say, “This is Science class.” Then ask the student, “What class is this?” Encourage the student to say, “This is Science class.”
Answer, “What do you do in Science class?” with, “I experiment in Science class.”
Circle the first picture and say,
(pretend to pour a beaker like you are doing an experiment
. Circle the second picture and say,
Clear the screen and have the child repeat two times.

Use a puppet: Ask the puppet, “What do you do in Science class?” The puppet should answer, “I do experiments in Science class.” Then ask the child, “What do you do in Science class?” Encourage the child to answer appropriately.

Use a puppet to model the question and answer. Ask the puppet, “What class is this?” Have the puppet say, “This is Social Studies class.” Then ask the student, “What class is this?” Encourage the student to say, “This is Social Studies class.”
Answer, “What do you do in S
class?” with, “I use a globe in Social Studies class.”
Circle the first picture and say,
. Circle the second picture and say,
Clear the screen and have the child repeat two times.

Use a puppet: Ask the puppet, “What do you do in Social Studies class?” The puppet should answer, “I use a globe in Social Studies class.” Then ask the child, “What do you do in Social Studies class?” Encourage the child to answer appropriately.
Answer, “What class is this?” in a complete sentence.
Circle one of the pictures. Ask, “What class is this?” Encourage the child to answer in complete sentences with the actions learned earlier in the lesson.
Pretend to play an guitar for the action for this class

Use a puppet to model the question and answer. Ask the puppet, “What class is this?” Have the puppet say, “This is Music class.” Then ask the student, “What class is this?” Encourage the student to say, “This is Music class.”
Pretend to play a guitar for the action for this class and say,
Pretend to paint a picture as the action for this class

Use a puppet to model the question and answer. Ask the puppet, “What class is this?” Have the puppet say, “This is Art class.” Then ask the student, “What class is this?” Encourage the student to say, “This is Art class.”
Pretend to paint a picture as the action for this class and say,
Pretend to run as the action for this class
Circle the kids running and say,

Use a puppet to model the question and answer. Ask the puppet, “What class is this?” Have the puppet say, “This is P.E. class.” Then ask the student, “What class is this?” Encourage the student to say, “This is P.E. class.”
Pretend to run as the action for this class and say,
The teacher will do an action. After she does the action, circle the correct picture and say the name of the class in a complete sentence.

Do an action (pretend to run, pretend to paint, pretend to play a guitar). Encourage the student to circle the picture that matches your action. Then encourage the student to say the name of the class in a complete sentence.
Answer, “What class is this?” in a complete sentence,
Circle the pictures that give you a clue as to what class it is.
Ask, “What class is this?” Encourage the child to answer in a complete sentence.
Encourage the student to circle things we use in Science class.
Answer, “What class is this?” in a complete sentence,
Circle the picture that give you a clue as to what class it is.
Ask, “What class is this?” Encourage the child to answer in a complete sentence.
Encourage the student to circle what we use in Math class.
Draw a line to match up the picture of the class to the class name
Tell the student to draw a line from the class picture to the class name. Do the first one to help the child if needed
Have the child read all the class names.
Freeform “Show and Tell” Conversation Activity Slide
Students should have a blank slide to draw a picture of
math, English, science, Social Studies, P.E., Music, Art
math, English, science, Social Studies. P.E., Music, Art)
Teacher will prompt student to draw a picture to represent
math, English, science, Social Studies, P.E., Music, Art
through pictures. One prompt at a time.
Teacher will write words from the lesson (
math, English, science, Social Studies, P.E., Music, Art)
Word Wall Vocabulary Builder Activity – Slide 22
Students will read and spell their new words:
math, English, science, Social Studies, P.E., Music, Art
Teacher will give feedback on the spelling and pronunciation of the new words.
